head.title: The Time Is Right for Acting, Dancing, Singing

hedline.hl1: The Time Is Right for Acting, Dancing, Singing

block.p: Following are selected lists, compiled by Anna Bahney, of events through September. The lists are national in scope but largely concentrate on the Northeast. All programs are subject to change.
Alabama

ALABAMA SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL -- Montgomery (800-841-4273). Productions in repertory through July 23: ''The Comedy of Errors,'' ''King Lear,'' ''Twelfth Night,'' ''A Month in the Country.'' May 23-July 23: ''A Night in Tunisia'' by Regina Taylor. May 30-July 23: ''A Man for All Seasons.'' www.asf.net
Following are selected lists, compiled by Anna Bahney, of events through September. The lists are national in scope but largely concentrate on the Northeast. All programs are subject to change.
Alabama

ALABAMA SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL -- Montgomery (800-841-4273). Productions in repertory through July 23: ''The Comedy of Errors,'' ''King Lear,'' ''Twelfth Night,'' ''A Month in the Country.'' May 23-July 23: ''A Night in Tunisia'' by Regina Taylor. May 30-July 23: ''A Man for All Seasons.'' www.asf.net
Arizona
NORTHERN ARIZONA SUMMERARTS -- Clifford White Theater, Flagstaff (888-502-7254). June 22-July 9: ''Galileo'' by Bertolt Brecht. July 14-23: ''Atomic'' by Russell Vandenbroucke. www.nau.edu/spa
California

CALIFORNIA SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL -- Bruns Amphitheater, Orinda (510-548-9666). June 1-24: ''The Taming of the Shrew.'' June 29-July 22: ''Hamlet.'' July 27-Aug. 19: ''Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead.'' Aug. 31-Sept. 9: ''Love's Labour's Lost.'' www. calshakes.org

LA JOLLA PLAYHOUSE -- (619-550-1010). May 30-July 2: ''Blood Wedding'' by Frederico Garcia Lorca. June 6-July 9: ''Lifegame'' by Keith Johnstone. July 18-Aug. 20: ''Sheridan'' by David Grimm. Aug.1-Sept. 3: ''The Cosmonaut's Last Message to the Woman He Loved in the Former Soviet Union'' by David Greig, American premiere. www.lajollaplayhouse.com
MAGIC THEATER -- San Francisco (415-441-8822). June 2-25: ''Kissing the Witch'' by Emma Donoghue. June 30-July 23: ''Summertime'' by Charles L. Mee Jr. www.magictheatre.org

MARK TAPER FORUM -- Music Center of Los Angeles County, Los Angeles (213-628-2772). Through May 21: ''Metamorphoses'' by Mary Zimmerman. June 8-July 16: ''The Poison Tree'' by Robert Glaudini. Aug. 3-27: ''Expecting Isabel'' by Lisa Loomer. www. taperahmanson.com

MUSIC CIRCUS -- Sacramento, July 10-Aug. 27 (916-557-1999). July 10-16: ''Evita.'' July 17-23: ''A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum.'' July 24-30: ''Anything Goes.'' July 31-Aug. 6: ''You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown.'' Aug. 7-13: ''Hello, Dolly!'' Aug. 14-20: ''Ain't Misbehavin.' '' Aug. 21-27: ''The King and I.''

NEW CONSERVATORY THEATER CENTER -- San Francisco, May 17-June 24 (415-861-8972). May 17-June 24: ''The Harvey Milk Show -- A Passion Play,'' book and lyrics by Dan Pruitt and music by Patrick Hutchinson. June 3-July 15: ''Torch Song Trilogy.'' June 10-July 16: ''The Secret of the Old Queen'' by Timothy Cope, with music by Paul Boesing. www.nctcsf.org

ODC THEATER -- San Francisco (415-863-9834). June 14-18: ''Too Tall Blondes Do Sex, Death and Gender.'' July 27-Aug. 6: ''N. A Play for None and All.'' July 7-8: ''It's Tough Enough When You Know Where You Are.'' www.odcdance.org/theater

OLD GLOBE THEATER -- San Diego, May 24-Oct. 7 (619-239-2255). Cassius Carter Center Stage: May 28-July 2: ''Old Wicked Songs.'' July 22-Aug. 26: ''God's Man in Texas.'' Lowell Davies Festival Theater: July 8-Aug. 12: ''Henry V.'' Sept. 9-Oct. 7: ''The Trojan Women.'' Old Globe Theater: June 1-July 2: ''The Full Monty,'' book by Terrence McNally, music and lyrics by David Yazbek, world premiere. July 29-Sept. 2: ''Things We Do for Love.'' Sept. 23-Oct. 28: ''Love's Labour's Lost.'' www.oldglobe.org
SADDLEBACK CIVIC LIGHT OPERA -- Saddleback College, Mission Viejo, June 30-Aug. 13 (949-582-4656). June 30-July 16: ''Man of La Mancha.'' June 21-Aug. 13: ''Stardust.'' July 28-Aug. 13: ''Grease.''

SAN FRANCISCO SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL -- (800-978-7529). June 22-July 2: Royal Shakespeare Company production of ''The Taming of the Shrew'' at the Herbst Theater. June 30-Oct. 1: ''King Henry IV, Part I.'' www.sfshakes.org

SHAKESPEARE SANTA CRUZ -- University of California, Santa Cruz (831-459-2121). July 12-Aug. 27: ''Love's Labour's Lost.'' July 23-Aug. 26: ''Cymbeline.'' July 21-Aug. 26: ''Kean'' by Jean-Paul Sartre. www.shakespearesantacruz.org
SOUTH COAST REPERTORY -- Costa Mesa (714-708-5555). May 26-July 2: ''The Education of Randy Newman'' by Michael Roth, Jerry Patch and Mr. Newman, world premiere. www.scr.org

WESTERN STAGE -- Hartnell College, Salinas, June 9-Sept. 17 (831-755-6816). June 9-25: ''Once on This Island.'' June 23-July 30: ''The Good Times Are Killing Me.'' July 21-Aug. 13: ''John Steinbeck's East of Eden.'' Aug. 11-Sept. 3: ''The Trojan Women.'' Sept. 1-17: ''Summer Stock.'' www.westernstage.org
Colorado

COLORADO SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL -- University of Colorado, Boulder, June 28-Aug. 26 (303-492-0554). In repertory: ''Twelfth Night,'' ''Julius Caesar,'' ''Henry V'' and ''The Tempest.'' www. coloradoshakes.org

CREEDE REPERTORY THEATER -- June 9-Sept. 16 (719-658-2540). June 9-Aug. 29: ''Charley's Aunt.'' June 16-Aug. 25: ''Pump Boys and Dinettes.'' June 30-Aug. 23: ''The Mousetrap.'' July 21-Aug. 24: ''Incorruptible'' by Michael Hoolinger. June 24-Aug. 26: ''Pinocchio 3.5'' by Eric Coble. July 21-Aug. 24: ''The Odyssey'' by Tom Smith. Aug. 4-25: ''Weed'' by Micki Panttaja. Aug. 31-Sept. 16: ''Love Letters.'' www.creederep.com
THEATERWORKS SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL -- Colorado Springs (719-262-3232). July 14-30: ''Twelfth Night.''
Connecticut
CONNECTICUT REPERTORY THEATER -- Storrs, June 9-July 29 (860-486-4226). June 9-24: ''West Side Story.'' June 30-July 15: ''Sweet Charity.'' July 20-29: ''The Foreigner.''
GOODSPEED OPERA HOUSE -- East Haddam (860-873-8668). Through July 1: ''Man of La Mancha.'' July 7-Oct. 7: ''George M!'' www.goodspeed.org
HARTFORD STAGE -- (860-527-5151). July 5-9: Jean Stapleton in ''Eleanor: Her Secret Journey'' by Rhoda Lerman. July 18-22: David Selby in ''St. Nicholas'' by Conor McPherson. www.hartfordstage.org

INTERNATIONAL FESTIVAL OF ARTS AND IDEAS -- New Haven and environs, June 16-July 1 (888-278-4332). In its fifth year, the event expands to offer theater, dance and music performances in Stamford and New London as well as New Haven. June 15-25: Royal Shakespeare Company in ''Macbeth.'' June 21-24: Teatro Hugo and Ines's production of ''Short Stories'' and the Saigon Water Puppet Theater. June 22-25: Societas Raffaello Sanzio production of ''Giulio Cesare.'' June 20-30: ''Shakespeare's Villains: A Master Class in Evil,'' with Steven Berkoff. www.artidea.org
SHAKESPEARE ON THE SOUND -- Rowayton (203-299-1300). June 8-25: ''A Midsummer Night's Dream.''

SUMMER CABARET AT YALE -- New Haven, June 27-Aug. 19 (203-432-1567). June 29-July 8: ''Poor Folk's Pleasure.'' July 12-22: ''The Metamorphosis.'' July 26-Aug. 5: ''Beyond Therapy.'' Aug. 9-19: ''The Mystery of Irma Vep.''

WESTPORT COUNTRY PLAYHOUSE -- June 12-Sept. 9 (203-227-4177). June 12-24: ''The Constant Wife.'' June 26-July 8: ''Orson's Shadow.'' July 10-22: ''Ancestral Voices.'' July 24-Aug. 5: ''Triangles for Two.'' Aug. 7-19: ''Morphic Resonance.'' Aug. 28-Sept. 9: ''Nicolette and Aucassin.'' www.westportplayhouse.org
Delaware
GRAND OPERA HOUSE -- Wilmington, July 24-28 (302-654-4468). ''City Theater's Y2K Delaware 10-Minute Play Festival'' presents 25 new plays in five nights.
District of Columbia
ARENA STAGE -- (202-488-3300). Through June 11: ''Blue'' by Charles Randolph-Wright, with Phylicia Rashad. www.arenastage.org
FORD'S THEATER -- (202-347-4833). Through June 18: ''Reunion: A Musical Epic in Miniature.'' www.fordstheatre.org

JOHN F. KENNEDY CENTER FOR THE PERFORMING ARTS -- (202-467-4600 or 800-444-1324). Sat.-May 28: ''Island: Arts From Ireland,'' a festival. Three American premieres: Andrews Lane Theater of Dublin production of ''Catalpa,'' written and performed by Donal O'Kelly (May 17-20); Druid Theater Company and Royal Court co-production of ''On Raftery's Hill'' by Marina Carr, directed by Garry Hynes (May 18-20); Rough Magic Theater Company of Dublin production of ''Pentecost'' by Stewart Parker (May 23-26). www.kennedy-center.org
SHAKESPEARE THEATER -- Carter Barron Amphitheater in Rock Creek Park (202-547-1122). June 9-18: ''The Merchant of Venice.'' Free.
SIGNATURE THEATER -- (703-218-6500). May 15-June 18: ''Side Show.'' www.sig-online.org
Florida
AMELIA COMMUNITY THEATER -- Fernandina Beach (904-261-6749). July 13-29: ''The Murder Room.''

CITY THEATER -- Coral Gables (305-365-5400). June 1-July 2: ''Summer Shorts Series'' presents premieres of 16 one-act comedies, dramas and musicals, including new works by David Ives, Tina Howe and David Lindsay-Abaire. www.citytheatre.com

SEASIDE MUSIC THEATER -- Daytona Beach, June 1-Aug. 20 (904-252-6200). June 1-11: ''Arsenic and Old Lace.'' June 15-25: ''Street Scene.'' June 29-July 16: ''A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum.'' July 20-30: ''Cyrano.'' Aug. 3-20: ''Damn Yankees.''

TAMPA BAY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER -- (813-222-1058). Through next Sunday: ''Swing, Swing, Swing.'' May 5-13: ''In the Name of the Mother.'' Tues.-next Sunday: ''Fame.'' May 25-June 11: ''The Accidental Death of an Anarchist.'' www.tampacenter. com
Georgia

REACH OF SONG -- Young Harris, June 6-Aug. 19 (706-379-1711). ''The Reach of Song,'' a musical drama about the history of Georgia and Appalachia, and the life of Byron Herbert Reece, a local poet and farmer. www. reachofsong.org
Illinois
GOODMAN THEATER -- Chicago (312-443-3800). June 26-July 29: ''Zoot Suit.'' www. goodman-theatre.org

INTERNATIONAL FESTIVAL OF PUPPET THEATER -- Chicago, June 1-4 (733-722-5463). The Art Institute of Chicago and Performing Arts Chicago present puppet performances at various sites in the city. Troupes include Janie Geiser and Company, New York; Saigon Water Puppet Theater, Vietnam; Horse Puppet Theater Company, Slovenia; Redmoon Theater, Chicago.

NEW PLAY 2000 -- Prop Thtr, Chicago, through Aug. 6 (773-486-7767). New works from around the country. Through next Sun.: Steppenwolf Theater and Prop Thtr production of ''The Terry Southern Show'' by Charles Pike and Nile Southern. Through June 11: Steppenwolf Theater production of ''Detail of a Larger Work'' by Lisa Dillman. June 8-18: Actor's Gang Theater (of Los Angeles) production of ''The Four Roses'' and ''Fairy Tales.'' June 22-25: Actor's Express (of Atlanta) production of ''Fairy Godmothers, Psychic Friend and Other Myth Information'' by Lori Hamilton. July 6-9: Annex Theater (of Seattle) production of ''Three Miracles and a Giant'' by Peggy Stafford. July 13-23: Woolly Mammoth Theater Company (of Washington) production of ''Chinese Art of Placement'' by Howard Shalwitz. July 27-30: Borderlands Theater (of Phoenix) production of ''Men on the Verge of a His-Panic Breakdown'' by Guillermo Reyes. Aug. 3-6: InterAct Theater (of Philadelphia) production of ''2000 Voices: Monologues at the Millennium'' by 14 Philadelphia-based writers. www.viprofix.com/ proptheatre.html

SUMMERFEST 2000 -- Krannert Center for the Performing Arts, Urbana, June 16-July 30 (217-333-6280). Repertory includes ''Barefoot in the Park,'' ''Murder at the Howard Johnson's,'' ''Tennessee Women.''
Indiana
CENTER FOR VISUAL AND PERFORMING ARTS -- Munster, May 18-Sept. 10 (219-836-3255). May 18-June 18: ''Pump Boys and Dinettes.'' June 29-July 30: ''Moon Over Buffalo.'' Aug. 10-Sept. 10: ''Gigi.''
FIREFLY FESTIVAL -- St. Patrick's County Park, South Bend, June 17-Aug. 5 (219-288-3472). June 23: ''Forever Plaid.'' July 27: ''42nd Street.'' www.ne.edu/crosenbe/ firefly.html
LINCOLN AMPHITHEATER -- Lincoln, June 23-Aug. 23 (800-264-4223). In repertory: ''Young Abe Lincoln,'' historical drama; ''The Music Man.'' www.lincoln-amphitheatre.com
NEW HARMONY THEATER -- June 9-Aug. 13 (877-648-7469). June 9-25: ''Noises Off.'' July 7-23: ''The Philadelphia Story.'' July 28-Aug. 13: ''Always . . . Patsy Cline.'' www. newharmonytheatre.com
Louisiana
SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL AT TULANE -- Tulane University, New Orleans, June 15-July 23 (504-865-5105). June 15-July 9: ''The Taming of the Shrew.'' June 29-July 23: ''Hamlet.''
SUMMER STAGES CHILDREN'S THEATER -- New Orleans, July 7-Aug. 27 (504-598-3800). July 7-23: ''Candy.'' Aug. 11-27: ''Moby Dick, the Musical.''
Maine
ACADIA REPERTORY THEATER -- Somesville, June 30-Aug. 27 (207-244-7260). Plays performed in repertory include ''Misery,'' ''On Golden Pond,'' ''Blithe Spirit,'' ''Appointment With Death.''

LAKEWOOD THEATER -- Madison, May 26-Oct. 9 (207-474-7176). May 25-27: ''The Taffetas.'' June 10-17: ''How the Other Half Loves.'' June 22-July 1: ''Anne of Avonlea.'' July 6-15: ''Fools.'' July 20-29: ''Life With Father.'' Aug. 31-Sept. 9: ''Getting and Spending.'' Sept. 14-23: ''Moose Murders.''

MAINE STATE MUSIC THEATER -- Brunswick, June 13-Aug. 26 (207-725-8769). June 13-24: ''Big River.'' June 27-July 8: ''Victor/Victoria.'' July 11-29: ''The Sound of Music.'' Aug. 1-12: ''Titanic.'' Aug. 15-26: ''Swingtime Canteen.'' www.msmt.org

OGUNQUIT PLAYHOUSE -- June 19-Sept. 3 (207-646-5511). Repertory includes, June 19-July 1: ''Art.'' July 3-July 15: ''Accomplice.'' July 17-29: ''The Will Rogers Follies.'' July 31-Aug. 12: ''The Complete Works of William Shakespeare (Abridged),'' Aug. 14-Sept. 3: ''Grease.'' www.ogunquitplayhouse.org

SANFORD MAINE STAGE COMPANY -- Springvale. Through Sept. 2 (207-324-9691). Through May 21: ''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory.'' June 9-24: ''Miss Reardon Drinks a Little.'' July 13-29: ''The Fantasticks.'' Aug. 17-Sept. 2: ''Bye Bye Birdie.''
Maryland
ANNAPOLIS SUMMER GARDEN THEATER -- May 26-Sept. 2 (410-268-9212). May 26-June 24: ''Jesus Christ Superstar.'' June 30-July 29: ''The Comedy of Errors.'' Aug. 4-Sept. 2: ''Once Upon a Mattress.''

COLUMBIA FESTIVAL OF THE ARTS -- June 16-25 (410-715-3044). Dance, theater, jazz and pop performances at various locations in the city. Includes performances by Marcel Marceau and Les Deux Mondes' ''Leitmotiv.''

OLNEY THEATER CENTER -- (301-924-3400). July 5-9: ''Two Gentlemen of Verona.'' July 11-Aug. 13: Third Annual Potomac Theater Festival presents ''Sueno'' by Pedro Calderon; ''Arcadia'' by Tom Stoppard; ''Collected Stories'' by Donald Margulies; workshop productions of new plays by Eastern European authors, directed by Nesta Jones. www.olneytheatre.org
Massachusetts

ACTORS THEATER OF NANTUCKET -- Fri.-Oct. 8 (508-228-6325). Fri.-June 3: ''Speed-the-Plow.'' June 13-July 8: ''After-Play.'' July 13-Aug. 12: ''Loot.'' Aug. 17-Sept. 16: ''Three Tall Women.'' Sept. 5-Oct. 8: ''And Now, Mark Twain!'' Sept. 21-Oct. 8: ''The Winter Guest.'' Family matinees of ''Marionette Folk Theater'' (June 27-July 8) and ''Charlotte's Web'' (July 18-Aug. 12). www.nantuckettheatre.com
AMERICAN REPERTORY THEATER -- Cambridge (617-547-8300). Thur.-June 11: ''The Winter's Tale.'' May 23-June 1: ''The Island of Anyplace.'' June 27-July 23: Marcel Marceau. www.amrep.org

BARRINGTON STAGE COMPANY -- Sheffield, June 21-July 16 (413-528-8888). Consolati Performing Arts Center. Mainstage: June 21-July 16: ''Company.'' July 19-Aug. 6: ''Full Bloom.'' Aug. 9-27: ''No Way to Treat a Lady.'' Stage II: July 6-16: ''Suburbia.'' Aug. 3-20: ''The Actor's Nightmare.'' Youth Theater: July 12-23: ''Guys and Dolls.'' www. barringtonstageco.org

BERKSHIRE THEATER FESTIVAL -- Stockbridge, June 21-Sept. 2 (413-298-5576). June 21-July 8: ''Camelot.'' July 11-22: ''Toys in the Attic.'' July 25-Aug. 12: ''The Shadow of Greatness.'' Aug. 15-Sept. 2: ''Say Yes!'' www.berkshiretheatre.org

CAPE COD REPERTORY THEATER -- Brewster (508-896-1888). May 18-June 10: ''Moon for the Misbegotten.'' June 27-Sept. 1: Clown's Play, at the Outdoor Theater. July 6-22: ''Travels With My Aunt.'' Aug. 3-26: ''Kiss of the Spider Woman.''

CAPE PLAYHOUSE -- Dennis, June 19-Sept. 9 (877-385-3911). June 19-July 1: ''Accomplice.'' July 3-15: ''Hay Fever.'' July 17-29: ''Visiting Mr. Green.'' July 31-Aug. 12: ''The Will Rogers Follies.'' Aug. 14-26: ''Lion in Winter.'' Aug. 28-Sept. 9: ''Radio Gals.''

COLLEGE LIGHT OPERA COMPANY -- Falmouth, June 27-Aug. 26 (440-774-8485, before June 2; 508-548-2211, thereafter). June 27-July 1: ''Pirates of Penzance.'' July 4-8: ''Oklahoma!'' July 11-15: ''The Merry Widow.'' July 25-29: ''Utopia, Limited.'' Aug. 1-5: ''Babes in Arms.'' Aug. 8-12: ''Candide.'' Aug. 15-19: ''Li'l Abner.'' Aug. 22-26: ''Evita.'' www.capecod.net/cloc
COMMONWEALTH SHAKESPEARE COMPANY -- Boston (617-423-7600). July 21-Aug. 13: ''The Tempest.'' Free.

HAMPSHIRE SHAKESPEARE COMPANY -- Amherst and Hadley (413-584-0731). Repertory performed outdoors at the Lord Jeffery Inn in Amherst and at the Hartsbrook-Waldorf School in Hadley. June 20-July 9: ''Twelfth Night.'' July 13-23: ''The Tempest.'' www.hampshireshakespeare.org

KO FESTIVAL OF PERFORMANCE AND NEW WORKS FOR A NEW WORLD -- Amherst College, Amherst, July 14-Aug. 6 (413-545-1972). The New World Theater and the Ko Festival of Performance present new works. July 14-16: ''The House Not Touched by Death'' by Janna Goodwin. July 21-22: Universes, a performing group. July 28-30: ''47 Frames'' by Cypher Collective. Aug. 4-6: ''Journey to Heaven: The Shaker Way'' by Pontine Movement Theater. www. newworldtheater.org or www.kofest.com
LE GRAND DAVID AND HIS OWN SPECTACULAR MAGIC COMPANY -- Cabot Street Cinema Theater, Beverly (978-927-3677). Sundays through July 30.

MONOMOY THEATER -- Chatham, June 20-Aug. 26 (508-945-1589). June 20-July 1: ''Damn Yankees.'' July 4-8: ''The Glass Menagerie.'' July 11-15: ''Lend Me a Tenor.'' July 18-22: ''The Corn Is Green.'' Aug. 1-5: ''Once in a Lifetime.'' Aug. 8-12: ''The Beauty Queen of Leenane.'' Aug. 15-19: ''Arsenic and Old Lace.'' Aug. 22-26: ''A Midsummer Night's Dream.''

NORTH SHORE MUSIC THEATER -- Beverly (978-922-8500). May 16-June 4: ''The Student Prince.'' June 13-July 2: ''Honk.'' July 18-Aug. 12: ''Peter Pan.'' Sept. 5-24: ''A Little Night Music.'' www.nsmt.org
REID THEATER AT DEERFIELD ACADEMY -- Deerfield (413-774-7476, ext. 2). July 6-29: ''She Stoops to Conquer.''

SHAKESPEARE AND COMPANY -- Edith Wharton estate, Lenox, May 26-Oct. 31 (413-637-3353). May 26-Sept. 2: ''The Wharton One-Acts.'' June 16-Sept. 3: ''Much Ado About Nothing.'' June 30-Aug. 6: ''Twelfth Night.'' July 14-Oct. 15: ''Jack and Jill'' by Jane Martin. July 19-Aug. 6: ''The Complete Works of William Shakespeare (Abridged).'' July 21-Sept. 2: ''Romeo and Juliet.'' Aug. 4-Sept. 3: ''Coriolanus.'' Aug. 12-Sept. 3: ''The Winter's Tale.'' Aug. 22-Sept. 3: The Eighth Annual Studio Festival of Plays, featuring readings, workshops and works-in-progress. www. shakespeare.org
TANGLEWOOD INSTITUTE THEATER -- Lenox (413-298-5504). Aug. 24-27: ''Running Man.''

TURTLE LANE PLAYHOUSE -- Newton, July 14-Sept. 24 (617-244-0169). Through June 4: ''Jesus Christ Superstar.'' July 14-Aug. 20: ''The Sound of Music.'' Sept. 8-24: ''You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown.''

VINEYARD PLAYHOUSE -- Vineyard Haven, June 15-Sept. 10 (508-696-6300). June 15-July 9: ''Spunk.'' July 13-30: ''A Life in the Theater.'' Aug. 3-20: ''The Beauty Queen of Leenane.'' Aug. 24-Sept. 10: ''Far East.'' www.vineyardplayhouse.org

WELLFLEET HARBOR ACTORS THEATER -- May 24-Sept. 3 (508-349-6835). May 24-June 25: ''The Beauty Queen of Leenane.'' July 5-July 23: A new play by Gip Hoppe. July 26-Aug. 5: ''Jimmy Triangle!'' July 3-Aug. 29: A new play written and performed by John Kuntz. Aug. 11-Sept. 3: ''Betty's Summer Vacation.'' Sept. 13-Oct. 8: ''Closer.'' www.what. org

WILLIAMSTOWN THEATER FESTIVAL -- June 15-Aug. 20 (413-597-3399). Adams Memorial Theater: June 16-July 2: ''Tonight at 8:30.'' July 5-16: ''The Hot L Baltimore.'' July 19-30: ''Hedda Gabler.'' Aug. 2-13: ''The Skin of Our Teeth.'' Aug. 16-27: ''Light Up the Sky.'' Nikos Stage: June 14-25: ''Orson's Shadow'' by Austin Pendleton. June 28-July 9: ''How I Fell in Love'' by Joel Fields. July 12-23: ''The Talk'' by Frank Pugliese. July 26-Aug. 6: ''The Late Middle Classes'' by Simon Gray, American premiere. Aug. 9-20: ''Christmas in Naples'' by Eduardo de Filippo. www. wtfestival.org

ZIETERION THEATER -- New Bedford (508-994-2900). July 12: ''Alice in Wonderland,'' Bits and Pieces Puppet Theater. July 26: ''Something's Fishy at Camp Wiganishie'' by Al Simmon. Aug. 2: ''Dragons Don't Sing Opera,'' Child Play Theater. Aug. 23: ''Little Red Riding Hood and Other Tales,'' Pushcart Players.
Michigan

ANN ARBOR SUMMER FESTIVAL -- June 17-July 8 (313-647-2278). Power Center for the Performing Arts. June 23: ''Morning, Noon and Night,'' with Spalding Gray. June 27: ''Y2K8.comedy,'' with Kate Clinton. June 28: Reduced Shakespeare Company in ''The Complete Millennium Musical.'' July 4: Capitol Steps. July 8: ''Behind the Broken Words.'' www.mlive.com/aasf

BARN THEATER -- Augusta, June 13-Sept. 10 (616-731-4121). June 13-25: ''E. R.'' June 27-July 9: ''Grease.'' July 11-23: ''Evita.'' July 25-Aug. 6: ''There Goes the Bride.'' Aug. 22-Sept. 3: ''My Fair Lady.'' Sept. 5-10: ''It Runs in the Family.'' www.barntheatre.com

RED BARN PLAYHOUSE -- Saugatuck (616-857-7707). June 7-25: ''Red Rock Diner.'' June 28-July 16: ''The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas.'' July 19-30: ''Guys and Dolls.'' Aug. 2-13: ''Zara Spook and Other Lures.'' Aug. 16-Sept 3: ''All I Really Need to Know I Learned in Kindergarten.'' www.redbarnplayhouse. com
Missouri
MUNICIPAL THEATER ASSOCIATION -- St. Louis (314-361-1900). June 2-Aug. 2: ''State Fair.'' Aug. 21-Sept. 20: ''High Society.'' '' www.muny.com

STARLIGHT THEATER -- Kansas City (816-363-7827). June 29-July 9: ''Miss Saigon.'' July 17-23: ''West Side Story.'' July 31-Aug. 6: ''The Prince and the Pauper.'' Aug. 7-13: ''Seven Brides for Seven Brothers.'' Aug. 22-27: ''Fosse.'' www.kcstarlight.com
Nebraska
NEBRASKA SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL -- Omaha, June 22-July 9 (402-280-2391). In repertory: ''Romeo and Juliet'' and ''The Complete Works of William Shakespeare (Abridged).'' neshakespeare.creighton.edu
New Hampshire

PETERBOROUGH PLAYERS THEATER -- June 21-Sept. 17 (603-924-7585). June 21-July 2: ''Sleuth.'' July 5-16: ''As Bees in Honey Drown.'' July 19-30: ''The Philanderer.'' Aug. 2-20: ''Our Town.'' Aug. 23-Sept. 3: ''Pump Boys and Dinettes.'' Sept. 6-17: ''A Coupla White Chicks Sitting Around Talking.''

WEATHERVANE THEATER PLAYERS -- Whitefield, July 1-Aug. 27 (603-837-9010). In repertory: ''Chicago,'' ''Swingtime Canteen,'' ''The Complete Works of William Shakespeare (Abridged),'' ''Fiddler on the Roof,'' ''Once on This Island,'' ''One for the Pot,'' ''The King and I,'' ''Love Letters.'' Children's theater: June 23, 30 and July 7: ''Pinocchio.'' July 14, 21 and 28: ''Dream.'' Aug. 4 and 11: ''A Handful of Peanuts.'' Aug. 18 and 25: ''Patchwork Potpourri.''
New Jersey

PLAYS-IN-THE-PARK -- Roosevelt Park, Edison, June 21-Aug. 31 (732-548-2884). June 21-July 1: ''A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum.'' July 12-22: ''Evita.'' Aug. 2-12: ''The King and I.'' Aug. 23-31: ''You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown.''

PUTTIN' ON THE RITZ THEATER -- Oaklyn (609-858-5230). June 2-4: New Play Festival. June 6-Aug. 5: ''Big: The Musical.'' June 15-17: ''Jack and the Beanstalk.'' July 12-15: ''The Knight Who Did Knight.'' Aug. 25-27: ''Geist, Contemporary Vaudevillianism.''
MCCARTER THEATER -- Princeton (609-683-8000). Through May 21: ''The Night Governess'' by Polly Pen, world premiere. May 30: ''The Flying Karamazov Brothers.'' www.mccarter.org
MONMOUTH COUNTY PARKS -- Lincroft, June 15-Aug. 13 (732-842-4000). June 15-July 2: ''Anything Goes.'' July 27-Aug. 13: ''Nunsense.'' www.monmouthcountyparks.com
NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER -- Newark (888-466-5722). June 13-18: ''The Who's Tommy.'' July 20-30: ''Brigadoon.'' www.njpac.org

NEW JERSEY SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL -- Madison (973-408-5600). June 13-July 2: ''The Forest'' by Alexander Ostrovsky. July 11-30: ''Twelfth Night.'' Aug. 8-27: ''Rhinoceros'' by Eugene Ionesco. Sept. 5-30: ''Antony and Cleopatra.'' www.njshakespeare.org

PRINCETON REPERTORY COMPANY -- June 30-Aug. 27 (609-921-3682). Outdoor performances at the amphitheater at Pettoranello Gardens and on the Green at Palmer Square. June 30-July 23: ''A Midsummer Night's Dream.'' Aug. 4-27: ''The Taming of the Shrew.'' www.princetonrep.org

SURFLIGHT THEATER -- Beach Haven (609-492-9477). The 51st annual Broadway at the Beach series. June 6-18: ''Brigadoon.'' June 20-July 22: ''Meet Me in St. Louis.'' July 5-16: ''Titanic.'' July 18-30: ''Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat.'' Aug. 1-13: ''The Sound of Music.'' Aug. 15-27: ''West Side Story.'' Aug. 29-Sept. 10: ''Victor/Victoria.'' Sept. 12-24: ''Babes in Arms.'' Children's Theater series, June 6-Sept. 10. June 6-25: ''Winnie the Pooh.'' June 28-July 2 and Aug. 16-20: ''Peter Pan.'' July 5-9: ''Sleeping Beauty.'' July 12-16: ''Cinderella.'' July 19-23 and Aug. 23-27: ''Wizard of Oz.'' July 26-30: ''The Little Mermaid.'' Aug. 2-6 and Sept. 6-10: ''Snow White.'' Aug. 9-13: ''The Lion Who Became King.'' Aug. 30-Sept. 3: ''Beauty and the Beast.''

THEATERFEST -- Montclair State University, Montclair, June 8-Aug. 6 (973-655-5112). June 8-11: ''Matters of the Heart.'' June 15-25: ''Master Class.'' June 29-July 9: ''Snakebit.'' July 13-16: ''Running From the Rhyme.'' July 20-Aug. 6: ''High Spirits.''

SANTA FE STAGES -- (505-982-6683). June 9-18: ''Guadalupe!'' June 23-July 2: Tomas Kubinek in ''Bed.'' July 21-Aug. 6: ''Death and the Maiden.'' www.santafestages.org
New York
New York City
ACTING COMPANY -- Playhouse at St. Clement's, through Sat. (212-279-4200). Tomorrow and Tues.: ''The Rivals.'' Thur.-Sat.: ''Macbeth.''

AQUILA THEATER -- Hummerdinger Hall, 100 E. Washington Square Place and Clark Center, 70 Lincoln Center Plaza, 7th fl. (718-499-6570). The British-American touring group presents works from its repertory. June 29-Aug. 6: ''The Iliad: Book One'' and ''The Comedy of Errors'' at Hummerdinger Hall. Aug. 17-Sept. 17: ''Cyrano de Bergerac'' at Clark Center. www.aquilatheatre.com

ASIA SOCIETY -- Grove St. Playhouse (212-517-2742). Presented as part of an Asia Society project, ''Sheer Realities: A Celebration of Philippine Culture.'' Today through May 21: Ma-Yi Theater Ensemble production of ''Li'l Brown Brothers/Nikimalika (I've Been to America).'' www.asiasociety.org

BROOKLYN ACADEMY OF MUSIC -- Majestic Theater, Brooklyn (718-636-4100). Through May 27: The Royal Shakespeare Company will be in residence for three weeks with performances of T. S. Eliot's ''Family Reunion,'' directed by Adrian Noble (Wed.-Sat.); Friedrich Schiller's ''Don Carlos,'' directed by Gale Edwards (Wed.-May 20); and ''A Midsummer Night's Dream,'' directed by Michael Boyd (May 21-27). Sept. 6-Oct. 1: Almeida Theater Company of London is in residence with ''Richard II'' (Sept. 6-Oct. 1) and ''Coriolanus'' (Sept. 9-30). Ralph Fiennes stars in both as the title characters, directed by Jonathan Kent. www.bam.org

GORILLA REPERTORY THEATER COMPANY -- (212-330-8086). Free productions of Shakespeare at various sites in the city. Ft. Triumph Park: Through June 25: ''Macbeth'' in repertory with ''Twelfth Night.'' Washington Square Park, Aug. 3-Sept. 24.: ''A Midsummer Night's Dream'' in repertory with ''As You Like It''; July 1-23: ''Ubu Is King!'' www.gorillarep.org

HUDSON RIVER FESTIVAL -- World Financial Center, June 20-Aug. 31 (212-845-0505). June 22-Aug. 31: Cosmic Bicycle Theater. July 6-9: Shakespeare Project performs ''Venus and Adonis.'' Aug. 16-20: Saigon Water Puppet Theater. www.worldfinancialcenter. com
JEAN COCTEAU REPERTORY -- Bouwerie Lane Theater, 330 Bowery (212-677-0060). June 2-30: ''The Butter and Egg Man.'' Aug. 18-Oct. 19: ''The Cradle Will Rock.'' www. jeancocteaurep.org

KINGS COUNTY SHAKESPEARE COMPANY -- Founders Hall Theater, 182 Remsen St., Brooklyn Heights (718-596-9685). Repertory includes: ''A Midsummer Night's Dream,'' ''The Rivals'' and a hip-hop version of ''A Midsummer Night's Dream.'' www. nytheatre-wire.com/kcsc.htm

LA MAMA EXPERIMENTAL THEATER CLUB -- 74A East Fourth St. (212-475-7710). May 18-28: A new biographical work written and performed by Denise Stoklos. May 18-June 4: ''The Wound,'' adapted by David Willinger from a novel by Paul Willems, a Belgian writer. May 25-June 4: ''Dreamboats and Sleepyheads'' by Charles Allcroft. June 8-25: ''High'' by the Slant ensemble. June 8-25: ''Do Wop Dracula,'' by William Electric Black. www.lamama.org

LINCOLN CENTER FESTIVAL -- New York State Theater (212-875-5030). July 11-16: Maly Drama Theater of St. Petersburg production of ''Brothers and Sisters,'' by Lev Dodin, Sergei Bekhterev and Arkady Katsman, based on a trilogy by Fyodor Abramov, directed by Mr. Dodin; in Russian with English supertitles. July 19-23: Vakhtangov Theater of Moscow production of Ostrovsky's ''Innocent as Charged,'' directed by Piotr Fomenko; in Russian with English translation on headsets. Also, a Lincoln Center Theater production at the Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater: June 29-Sept. 17: ''Spinning Into Butter'' by Rebecca Gilman, directed by Daniel Sullivan. www. lincolncenter.org

NEW YORK INTERNATIONAL FRINGE FESTIVAL -- Aug. 16-27 (212-420-8877). More than 150 national and international theatrical productions at indoor and outdoor sites throughout the city, including the Me Xihc Co Teatro company in ''Muerte'' and ''Cruces''; the West End Opera of Munich, Germany, in ''HipHopera''; Theater in der Westentasche ulm's in ''The Hungarian Medea''; People's Little Theater of Calcutta in ''Tiner Talwar,'' and Vis Plastica of Austria in ''Perpetuum Mobile.'' www.fringenyc.org

NEW YORK SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL -- Delacorte Theater (212-539-8750). Free performances in Central Park by the Joseph Papp Public Theater/New York Shakespeare Festival. June 21-July 16: ''The Winter's Tale'' directed by Brian Kulick. Aug. 8-Sept. 3: ''Julius Caesar'' directed by Barry Edelstein. www.publictheater.org

ON STAGE AT THE TWIN TOWERS -- The World Trade Center's Austin Tobin Plaza, June 6-24 (212-435-4170). A series of free, outdoor music, theater and dance events. June 22: ''Interviewing the Audience,'' with Spalding Gray. www.panynj.gov/onstage

REPERTORIO ESPANOL -- Gramercy Arts Theater, through June 14. (212-889-2850). Through Sat.: ''Proxima Parada'' (''The Next Stop'') by Carmen Rivera. Through May 24: ''Parece Blanca'' (''She Looks White'') by Abelardo Estorino. Through May 25: ''Cronica de Una Muerte Anunciada'' (''Chronicle of a Death Foretold'') by Gabriel Garcia Marquez. Through May 28: ''El Baile'' (''The Dance'') by Mr. Estorino. Through June 1: ''La Casa de Bernarda Alba'' (''The House of Bernarda Alba'') by Federico Garcia Lorca. Through June 13: ''La Gringa'' by Ms. Rivera. Through June 14: ''Casa Propia'' (''A House of Our Own'') by Dolores Prida. Also in residence will be Teatro Gayumba from the Dominican Republic with three plays in repertory from May 30-June 10: ''Don Quijote y Sancho Panza,'' ''Esta Era Una Vez . . .'' (''Once Upon a Time. . . . '') and ''La Dama Duende'' (''The Phantom Lady''). www. repertorio.org
SWEDISH COTTAGE MARIONETTE THEATER -- In Central Park at 81st St. Daytime performances of ''Jack and the Beanstalk.''

THEATER FOR THE NEW CITY -- 155 First Ave. (212-254-1109). May 26-28: Lower East Side Festival of the Arts. Opening June 8: ''New York Values,'' written and performed by Penny Arcade. Aug. 5-Sept. 17: Street Theater Extravaganza presents ''Biotech,'' in parks, streets and playgrounds throughout the five boroughs. members.aol.com/tnctheater
WAGNER SUMMER THEATER -- Wagner College, Staten Island, June 28-July 30 (718-390-3259). June 28-July 9: ''A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum.'' July 19- 30: ''Company.''

DEPOT THEATER -- Westport, June 30-Sept. 10 (516-962-4449). June 30-July 9: ''Absurd Person Singular.'' July 14-23: ''I Do! I Do!'' July 28-Aug. 6: ''Bell, Book and Candle.'' Aug. 18-Sept. 10: ''On the Town.''

GATEWAY PLAYHOUSE -- Bellport, May 17-Sept. 16 (516-286-1133). May 17-June 3: ''Pippin.'' June 7-24: ''The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas.'' June 28-July 15: ''George M!'' July 19-Aug. 5: ''South Pacific. Aug. 9-26: ''The Music of Andrew Lloyd Webber. Aug. 30-Sept. 16: ''The Will Rogers Follies.'' www. gatewayplayhouse.com

GUILD HALL -- 158 Main St., East Hampton (631-324-0806). Through May 27: ''Greater Tuna.'' June 23-25: ''The Last, the Very Last Butterfly.'' Play readings by the Blue Heron Theater Company and the Abington Theater Company throughout the summer. www. guildhall.org

HAMPTONS SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL -- Amagansett and environs (516-267-0105). ''Much Ado About Nothing.'' Aug. 2-20: Theodore Roosevelt County Park in Montauk. Aug. 24-Sept. 3: Agawam Park in Southhampton.

HOFSTRA UNIVERSITY -- Hempstead, June 16-Aug. 20 (516-463-6644). June 16-July 2: ''The Witch of Wall Street'' by M. Champagne and Elliot Weiss. July 14-30: ''The Sound of Music.'' Aug. 4-20: ''Master Class.''

HUNTINGTON SUMMER ARTS FESTIVAL -- June 23-Aug. 20 (516-271-8423). Eight weeks of theater, dance and musical concerts in Heckscher Park. June 27: ''The Wizard of Oz.'' July 1: ''The King and I.'' ADIRONDACK THEATER FESTIVAL -- Former Woolworth Store, 217 Glen St., Glens Falls, June 21-July 2 (518-798-7479). June 21-July 2: ''Wit.'' July 5-9: ''The Five and Dime Plays.'' July 13-22: ''Barbara's Blue Kitchen.'' www. festival.org
BROADWAY AT THE PARK SERIES -- Lewiston, July 7-Sept. 3 (716-754-4375). July 7-23: ''Show Boat.'' July 28-Aug. 13: ''Grease.'' Aug. 18-Sept. 3: ''Man of La Mancha.''

CHAUTAUQUA INSTITUTION -- June 24-Aug. 27 (800-836-2787). In its 126th season, the festival offers operas, chamber and orchestral concerts, jazz and pop performances, and theater and dance productions. Under the artistic director, Rebecca Guy, theater is presented in Normal Hall. July 8-15: ''Arms and the Man.'' July 22-29: ''The Tempest.'' Aug. 5-12: ''Collected Stories.'' Aug. 17-19: ''Street Scene.'' www.chautauqua-inst.org

FORESTBURGH PLAYHOUSE -- May 20-Sept. 2 (914-794-1194). May 20-28: ''The Mousetrap.'' June 27-July 8: ''Guys and Dolls.'' July 11-22: ''Man of La Mancha.'' Aug. 8-19: ''Little Shop of Horrors.'' Aug. 22-26: ''No Sex Please, We're British.'' Aug. 28-Sept. 2: ''Sunshine Boys.'' On Thurs. and Sat. afternoons a repertory of children's plays: ''Jack and the Beanstalk,'' ''The Emperor's New Clothes,'' ''Cinderella,'' ''Little Red Riding Hood'' and a puppet show. www.fbplayhouse.com

HANGAR THEATER -- Ithaca (800-724-0999). June 1-10: ''The Woman in Black.'' June 15-24: ''Don't Dress for Dinner.'' June 29-July 15: ''Dames at Sea.'' July 20-29: ''Moon for the Misbegotten.'' Aug. 2-12: ''Greater Tuna.'' www.hangartheatre.org
HUDSON VALLEY SHAKESPEARE -- Garrison, June 21-Aug. 27 (914-265-9575). June 21-July 30: ''Measure for Measure.'' July 19-Aug. 27: ''Taming of the Shrew.'' www. hvshakespeare.org

Aug. 10-20: ''The Will Rogers Follies.'' Aug. 24-Sept. 3: ''Annie.''
MERRY GO ROUND PLAYHOUSE -- Auburn, May 31-Aug. 26 (800-457-8897). May 31-June 17: ''Nunsense.'' June 21-July 8: ''Evita.'' July 12-29: ''My Fair Lady.'' Aug. 2-26: ''Gypsy.''

MOHONK FESTIVAL OF THE ARTS -- New Paltz, July 7-Aug. 18 (914-255-1000 or 800-772-6646). A series of music, dance and theater performances at the Victorian-era Mohonk Mountain House. Performances include vignettes by the Cashore Marionettes; excerpts from ''Molly Sweeney''; Peggy Cowles in ''Masks and Voices''; Frances Sternhagen and John Cunningham in an evening of scenes; and Arlene Sterne in ''Final Curtain,'' a one-woman-show. www.mohonk.com

PENDRAGON SUMMER REPERTORY THEATER -- Saranac Lake, June 1-Sept. 2 (518-891-1854). In repertory: ''What the Butler Saw,'' ''The Heiress,'' ''Scapino'' and ''Just So,'' adapted from ''The Just So Stories'' by Jan Silverman. www.northnet.org/pendragon
PENGUIN REPERTORY COMPANY -- Stony Point (914-786-2873). June 8-July 2: ''The Mysterious Mr. Love.''
SHAKESPEARE AT THE VANDERBILT -- Suffolk County Vanderbilt Museum, Centerport, July 2-Sept. 3 (516-854-5511). July 2-30: ''Much Ado About Nothing.'' Aug. 3-Sept. 3: ''Romeo and Juliet.''
STAGEWORKS -- Kinderhook (518-822-9667). Through next Sun.: ''Ten by Ten: The Black and White Plays.'' July 15: ''Psyche.'' Aug. 9-27: ''Three Days of Rain.'' www.mhonline. net/stagewrk

VASSAR AND NEW YORK STAGE AND FILM'S POWERHOUSE THEATER -- Poughkeepsie, June 23-Aug. 5 (914-437-5902, before June 1; 914-437-5599, thereafter). Performances in two theaters on the Vassar College campus. Powerhouse Theater: June 28-July 15: ''The Lively Lad'' by Quincy Long. July 20-23: Work-in-progress presentations of ''Frog and Toad'' by Rob and Willie Reale, ''Jules's Blues'' by Jules Feiffer. July 26-Aug. 5: ''The Dazzle'' by Richard Greenberg. Susan Stein Shiva Theater: June 23-25: ''A Map of Doubt and Rescue'' by Susan Miller. June 30-July 2: ''Modern Apocalypse'' by Cindy Lou Johnson. July 7-9: ''What Didn't Happen'' by Christopher Shinn. July 14-16: Readings of new plays. July 21-23: ''The Hurdy Gurdy Man'' by Dick Beebe. July 28-30: ''Necessary Targets'' Eve Ensler. www.vassar.edu/powerhouse
WATERMAN SUMMER THEATER -- State University of New York, Oswego (315-341-2141). July 19-23: ''No, No Nanette.''
North Carolina

FLAT ROCK PLAYHOUSE -- (704-693-0731). May 17-28: ''The Taffetas.'' May 31-June 17: ''Proposals.'' June 21-July 9: ''42nd Street.'' July 12-29: ''You Can't Take It With You.'' Aug. 2-20: ''Oklahoma!'' Aug. 23-Sept. 3: ''Here on the Flight Path.'' www. flatrockplayhouse.org
Ohio

CAIN PARK -- Cleveland Heights, June 15-Aug. 19 (216-371-3000). An outdoor series of dance, theater, cabaret and music concerts. Theater productions include ''Damn Yankees'' (June 15-July 2), ''SWS: Sisters With Stories'' (June 28) and ''Violet'' (July 27-30).

OHIO LIGHT OPERA -- Wooster, June 15-Aug. 12 (330-263-2345). In repertory: ''The Gypsy Baron,'' ''Naughty Marietta,'' ''The Mikado,'' ''Camelot,'' ''Le Petit Duc,'' ''Utopia Limited,'' ''The Cousin from Batavia.'' www.wooster.edu/oh
Correction: May 21, 2000, Sunday A classical music entry in the Summer Festivals listing on May 7 for Washington State misstated the telephone number for the Seattle Symphony. It is (206) 215-4747.
A Maine entry for the Portland Opera Repertory Theater misstated its telephone number. It is (207) 842-0800.

A California entry for the San Francisco Conservatory of Music misstated some locations for its summer festival. A lecture on June 7 will be in Toland Hall at the University of California at San Francisco. The other concerts and lectures will be at the conservatory's Hellman Hall.
A pop music entry for New York included an outdated reference to one performer at the Lincoln Center Festival. Talvin Singh will not appear.
Correction: May 21, 2000, Sunday
A classical music entry in the Summer Festivals listing on May 7 for Washington State misstated the telephone number for the Seattle Symphony. It is (206) 215-4747.
A Maine entry for the Portland Opera Repertory Theater misstated its telephone number. It is (207) 842-0800.

A California entry for the San Francisco Conservatory of Music misstated some locations for its summer festival. A lecture on June 7 will be in Toland Hall at the University of California at San Francisco. The other concerts and lectures will be at the conservatory's Hellman Hall.
A pop music entry for New York included an outdated reference to one performer at the Lincoln Center Festival. Talvin Singh will not appear.
